intro: Luzula racemosa var. ulophylla, commonly known as the slender wood sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces dense, spike-like inflorescences that bear small, three-lobed flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. This variety is distinguished by its slender stems and foliage, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
